item.name: Aku Djinn
item.text: Trample At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature each opponent controls.
item.flavorText: "Your arrogance amazes me, Kaervek. Did you not know the price you would pay?" —Mangara

item.name: Anvil of Bogardan
item.text: Players have no maximum hand size. At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card, then discards a card.

item.name: Archangel
item.text: Flying, vigilance
item.flavorText: "My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike." —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

item.name: Army Ants
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target land.
item.flavorText: "Do not underestimate the power of many against one." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Betrayal
item.text: Enchant creature an opponent controls Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, you draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Sometimes a burden can be borne only on the shoulders of a willing enemy." —Suq'Ata aphorism

item.name: Blanket of Night
item.text: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
item.flavorText: "Kaervek imprisoned Mangara out of jealousy, but he taints Jamuraa simply out of spite." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Bogardan Phoenix
item.text: Flying When Bogardan Phoenix is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, exile it if it had a death counter on it. Otherwise, return it to the battlefield under your control and put a death counter on it.

item.name: Brass-Talon Chimera
item.text: First strike Sacrifice Brass-Talon Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains first strike. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Breathstealer's Crypt
item.text: If a player would draw a card, instead he or she draws a card and reveals it. If it's a creature card, that player discards it unless he or she pays 3 life.
item.flavorText: "Far too many soldiers have died in their beds." —Telim'Tor

item.name: Breezekeeper
item.text: Flying Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
item.flavorText: "He blows a gust across the cliff to vanish in a breath of wind." —"Song of the Wind Being"

item.name: Brood of Cockroaches
item.text: When Brood of Cockroaches is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of the next end step, you lose 1 life and return Brood of Cockroaches to your hand.
item.flavorText: "It's like waking on a bed of a thousand olives during an earthquake of subtle force." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Bull Elephant
item.text: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.
item.flavorText: Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I? —Zhalfirin riddle

item.name: Chronatog
item.text: {0}: Chronatog gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
item.flavorText: For the chronatog, there is no meal like the present.

item.name: City of Solitude
item.text: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.
item.flavorText: "My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen." —Naimah, Femeref philosopher

item.name: Cloud Elemental
item.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
item.flavorText: "You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you." —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

item.name: Coercion
item.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
item.flavorText: A rhino's bargain —Femeref expression meaning "a situation with no choices"

item.name: Coral Atoll
item.text: Coral Atoll enters the battlefield tapped. When Coral Atoll enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand. {T}: Add {1}{U} to your mana pool.

item.name: Corrosion
item.text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.) At the beginning of your upkeep, put a rust counter on each artifact target opponent controls. Then destroy each artifact with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of rust counters on it. Artifacts destroyed this way can't be regenerated. When Corrosion leaves the battlefield, remove all rust counters from all permanents.

item.name: Creeping Mold
item.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
item.flavorText: "Mold could catch you." —Suq'Ata insult

item.name: Crypt Rats
item.text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana this way.
item.flavorText: "Once I dreamt of death, but now it dreams of me / And only rats and rotting flesh can hear my silent plea." —Mundungu chant

item.name: Daraja Griffin
item.text: Flying Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.
item.flavorText: "And the flamingos said, ‘Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you' So, the griffin ate them." —Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

item.name: Dark Privilege
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+1. Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate enchanted creature.
item.flavorText: "As you breathe your last, understand why I accept such forbidden gifts." —Purraj of Urborg

item.name: Death Watch
item.text: Enchant creature When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, its controller loses life equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.
item.flavorText: "Watch death wait / Wait, death, watch / Steal breath swiftly / but steal life slowly." —Suq'Ata dirge

item.name: Desertion
item.text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
item.flavorText: First the insult, then the injury.

item.name: Desolation
item.text: At the beginning of each end step, each player who tapped a land for mana this turn sacrifices a land. If a Plains is sacrificed this way, Desolation deals 2 damage to that Plains's controller.
item.flavorText: "Kill a creature, destroy the present. Kill the land, destroy the future." —Kaervek

item.name: Diamond Kaleidoscope
item.text: {3}, {T}: Put a 0/1 colorless Prism artifact creature token onto the battlefield. Sacrifice a Prism token: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "A pretty toy. Now show me its tactical applications." —Telim'Tor

item.name: Dormant Volcano
item.text: Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield tapped. When Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Mountain you control to its owner's hand. {T}: Add {1}{R} to your mana pool.

item.name: Dragon Mask
item.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
item.flavorText: "With no further options, I was forced to don the mask." —Rashida Scalebane

item.name: Dream Tides
item.text: Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped nongreen creatures he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

item.name: Dwarven Vigilantes
item.text: Whenever Dwarven Vigilantes attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Dwarven Vigilantes assigns no combat damage this turn.
item.flavorText: Some dwarves can only be pushed so far.

item.name: Elephant Grass
item.text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.) Black creatures can't attack you. Nonblack creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
item.flavorText: "How have I angered nature that she would imprison me in a labyrinth of grass?" —Kasib ibn Naji, Letters

item.name: Elkin Lair
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player exiles a card at random from his or her hand. The player may play that card this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, if the player hasn't played the card, he or she puts it into his or her graveyard.

item.name: Elven Cache
item.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
item.flavorText: "The elves can hide better than most can look." —Mwani, Mtenda herder

item.name: Emerald Charm
item.text: Choose one — Untap target permanent; or destroy target non-Aura enchantment; or target creature loses flying until end of turn.

item.name: Equipoise
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, for each land target player controls in excess of the number you control, choose a land he or she controls, then the chosen permanents phase out. Repeat this process for artifacts and creatures. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before that player untaps during his or her next untap step.)

item.name: Everglades
item.text: Everglades enters the battlefield tapped. When Everglades enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Swamp you control to its owner's hand. {T}: Add {1}{B} to your mana pool.

item.name: Eye of Singularity
item.text: When Eye of Singularity enters the battlefield, destroy each permanent with the same name as another permanent, except for basic lands. They can't be regenerated. Whenever a permanent other than a basic land enters the battlefield, destroy all other permanents with that name. They can't be regenerated.

item.name: Fallen Askari
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) Fallen Askari can't block.
item.flavorText: In troubled times, there are few greater sorrows than a wayward savior.

item.name: Femeref Enchantress
item.text: Whenever an enchantment is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Then she spread a fine dust over the land, like a butterfly shaking its wing." —"The Enchantress," Femeref tale

item.name: Feral Instinct
item.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
item.flavorText: "If a rhino's head is lower than its shoulders, trust me—it is not praying." —Mwani, Mtenda herder

item.name: Fireblast
item.text: You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Fireblast's mana cost. Fireblast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: Embermages aren't well known for their diplomatic skills.

item.name: Firestorm Hellkite
item.text: Flying, trample Cumulative upkeep {U}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
item.flavorText: "If it can scar the sky with fire, do not share its destination." —Mwani, Mtenda herder

item.name: Flooded Shoreline
item.text: {U}{U}, Return two Islands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Some say the sea is jealous of the land and wishes to climb its heights to meet the sky." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Forbidden Ritual
item.text: Sacrifice a nontoken permanent. If you do, target opponent loses 2 life unless he or she sacrifices a permanent or discards a card. You may repeat this process any number of times.

item.name: Foreshadow
item.text: Name a card, then put the top card of target opponent's library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you draw a card. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

item.name: Freewind Falcon
item.text: Flying, protection from red
item.flavorText: "That does it I'm going back to hunting chickens" —Rhirhok, goblin archer

item.name: Funeral Charm
item.text: Choose one — Target player discards a card; or target creature gets +2/-1 until end of turn; or target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn.

item.name: Giant Caterpillar
item.text: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
item.flavorText: "‘I've seen hornworms big as a man's fist,' the traveler said, and nodded soberly when our jaws went slack at his ignorance." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Goblin Recruiter
item.text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
item.flavorText: "Next"

item.name: Goblin Swine-Rider
item.text: Whenever Goblin Swine-Rider becomes blocked, it deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and each blocking creature.
item.flavorText: "May you get the mount you deserve." —Suq'Ata curse

item.name: Gossamer Chains
item.text: Return Gossamer Chains to its owner's hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target unblocked creature this turn.
item.flavorText: "Harah swung his sword mightily, but still the air held him fast." —Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

item.name: Griffin Canyon
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Untap target Griffin. If it's a creature, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Where are falling feathers deadlier than falling rock?" —The One Thousand Questions

item.name: Guiding Spirit
item.text: Flying {T}: If the top card of target player's graveyard is a creature card, put that card on top of that player's library.
item.flavorText: "Retainer of eternal Sun Life flash again upon thy wings." —"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

item.name: Hearth Charm
item.text: Choose one — Destroy target artifact creature; or attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn; or target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

item.name: Heat Wave
item.text: Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.) Blue creatures can't block creatures you control. Nonblue creatures can't block creatures you control unless their controller pays 1 life for each blocking creature he or she controls.

item.name: Helm of Awakening
item.text: Spells cost {1} less to cast.
item.flavorText: "This little prize will cover your head, your spells, your bets, and your behind" —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

item.name: Honorable Passage
item.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals that much damage to the source's controller.

item.name: Hope Charm
item.text: Choose one — Target creature gains first strike until end of turn; or target player gains 2 life; or destroy target Aura.

item.name: Hulking Cyclops
item.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
item.flavorText: "Some say a great cyclops turns the world in its hands, looking down upon it with its one bright eye." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Impulse
item.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.
item.flavorText: "Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again." —Teferi

item.name: Infantry Veteran
item.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war." —Telim'Tor

item.name: Infernal Harvest
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Infernal Harvest, return X Swamps you control to their owner's hand. Infernal Harvest deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
item.flavorText: "I offered you eternal life; I just didn't say where." —Shauku, Endbringer

item.name: Inspiration
item.text: Target player draws two cards.
item.flavorText: "Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Iron-Heart Chimera
item.text: Vigilance Sacrifice Iron-Heart Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains vigilance. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Jamuraan Lion
item.text: {W}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
item.flavorText: The lion blinked —Femeref expression meaning "situation avoided"

item.name: Juju Bubble
item.text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.) When you play a card, sacrifice Juju Bubble. {2}: You gain 1 life.
item.flavorText: "If my heart had a lid, I would lift it and show you my joy." —From Suq'Ata wedding ceremony

item.name: Jungle Basin
item.text: Jungle Basin enters the battlefield tapped. When Jungle Basin enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Forest you control to its owner's hand. {T}: Add {1}{G} to your mana pool.

item.name: Kaervek's Spite
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Kaervek's Spite, sacrifice all permanents you control and discard your hand. Target player loses 5 life.
item.flavorText: "The end justifies the means. What do I care if I rule over the dead rather than over the living? The dead ask fewer questions." —Kaervek

item.name: Karoo
item.text: Karoo enters the battlefield tapped. When Karoo enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Plains you control to its owner's hand. {T}: Add {1}{W} to your mana pool.

item.name: Katabatic Winds
item.text: Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.) Creatures with flying can't attack or block, and their activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.
item.flavorText: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

item.name: Keeper of Kookus
item.text: {R}: Keeper of Kookus gains protection from red until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Wanted: Thick-skinned goblin for guarding mean ol' Kookus. Must like fires. Must heal quickly.

item.name: King Cheetah
item.text: Flash
item.flavorText: If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a King Cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend. —Suq'Ata wisdom

item.name: Knight of the Mists
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) When Knight of the Mists enters the battlefield, you may pay {U}. If you don't, destroy target Knight and it can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: Fear the mists, for they are armed.

item.name: Knight of Valor
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) {1}{W}: Each creature without flanking blocking Knight of Valor gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

item.name: Kookus
item.text: Trample At the beginning of your upkeep, if you don't control a creature named Keeper of Kookus, Kookus deals 3 damage to you and attacks this turn if able. {R}: Kookus gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

item.name: Kyscu Drake
item.text: Flying {G}: Kyscu Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn. Sacrifice Kyscu Drake and a creature named Spitting Drake: Search your library for a card named Viashivan Dragon and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Lead-Belly Chimera
item.text: Trample Sacrifice Lead-Belly Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Lichenthrope
item.text: If damage would be dealt to Lichenthrope, put that many -1/-1 counters on it instead. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from Lichenthrope.

item.name: Lightning Cloud
item.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {R}. If you do, Lightning Cloud deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: The mightiest clouds sit upon spires of fire. —Femeref adage

item.name: Longbow Archer
item.text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: "If it bears wings, I will put it to the skies over Tefemburu." —Ruya, Zhalfirin archer

item.name: Magma Mine
item.text: {4}: Put a pressure counter on Magma Mine. {T}, Sacrifice Magma Mine: Magma Mine deals damage equal to the number of pressure counters on it to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: BOOM

item.name: Man-o'-War
item.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch." —Naimah, Femeref philosopher

item.name: Matopi Golem
item.text: {1}: Regenerate Matopi Golem. When it regenerates this way, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
item.flavorText: Some potmakers claim to use the mud of such creatures to make their finest bowls—and that the bowls scream when fired.

item.name: Miraculous Recovery
item.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
item.flavorText: "You stop breathing for just a few minutes and everyone jumps to conclusions." —Zarkuu, necrosavant

item.name: Mob Mentality
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has trample. Whenever all non-Wall creatures you control attack, enchanted creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
item.flavorText: "Why is loud stupidity so infectious?" —Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

item.name: Mortal Wound
item.text: Enchant creature When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
item.flavorText: "Their tears spill over Jamuraa. Mixed with blood, they wash everything red." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Mundungu
item.text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} and 1 life.
item.flavorText: "Our buried kings silently await the revolt of dead peasants." —Tuwile, mundungu of Aku

item.name: Mystic Veil
item.text: You may cast Mystic Veil as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. Enchant creature Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: "Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were." —Poetics of Hanan

item.name: Natural Order
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Natural Order, sacrifice a green creature. Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: . . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life.

item.name: Necromancy
item.text: You may cast Necromancy as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. When Necromancy enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Necromancy." Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control and attach Necromancy to it. When Necromancy leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.

item.name: Necrosavant
item.text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
item.flavorText: "Ah, I remember my first death." —Zarkuu, necrosavant

item.name: Nekrataal
item.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.) When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say." —Jolrael

item.name: Ogre Enforcer
item.text: Ogre Enforcer can't be destroyed by lethal damage unless lethal damage dealt by a single source is marked on it.
item.flavorText: "Ate up all of his siblings in the first week. A good beginning for one destined to command." —Suka, ogre matron

item.name: Ovinomancer
item.text: When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand. {T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller puts a 0/1 green Sheep creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Panther Warriors
item.flavorText: "When you run you're graceful and swift, sleek as a powerful panther." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Parapet
item.text: You may cast Parapet as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. Creatures you control get +0/+1.
item.flavorText: There is no wall that can't be improved by making it taller.

item.name: Peace Talks
item.text: This turn and next turn, creatures can't attack, and players and permanents can't be the targets of spells or activated abilities.
item.flavorText: "By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie." —Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat

item.name: Phyrexian Marauder
item.text: Phyrexian Marauder enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it. Phyrexian Marauder can't block. Phyrexian Marauder can't attack unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.

item.name: Phyrexian Walker
item.flavorText: "I have heard terrible tales of black rains, ashen fields, and metal that screams. I have consoled myself that the tales were a myth of some fevered mind. But today I saw a walker—and now I fear the truth." —Kasib Ibn Naji, Letters

item.name: Pillar Tombs of Aku
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may sacrifice a creature. If that player doesn't, he or she loses 5 life and you sacrifice Pillar Tombs of Aku.
item.flavorText: "Aku, City of Hidden Graves / Aku, City of Lost Kings / Aku, welcome me." —Pillar tomb inscription

item.name: Prosperity
item.text: Each player draws X cards.
item.flavorText: "Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently." —Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

item.name: Pygmy Hippo
item.text: Whenever Pygmy Hippo attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player activate a mana ability of each land he or she controls and empty his or her mana pool. If you do, Pygmy Hippo assigns no combat damage this turn and at the beginning of your postcombat main phase, you add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the amount of mana emptied from defending player's mana pool this way.

item.name: Python
item.flavorText: "How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?" —Hakim, Loreweaver

item.name: Quicksand
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.

item.name: Quirion Druid
item.text: {G}, {T}: Target land becomes a 2/2 green creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
item.flavorText: "The land has been gracious enough to let you tread upon her for years. That privilege is about to end." —Liefellen, Quirion exarch

item.name: Quirion Ranger
item.text: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
item.flavorText: "Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket." —Liefellen, Quirion exarch

item.name: Raging Gorilla
item.text: Whenever Raging Gorilla blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Every temper tantrum makes another angry gorilla." —Femeref children's myth

item.name: Rainbow Efreet
item.text: Flying {U}{U}: Rainbow Efreet phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
item.flavorText: "A beauty made more so by its fleeting visitations." —Teferi

item.name: Relentless Assault
item.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
item.flavorText: "Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee." —Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry

item.name: Relic Ward
item.text: You may cast Relic Ward as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. Enchant artifact Enchanted artifact has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: Asmira's prayers alone should have freed Mangara from the amber prison . . .

item.name: Remedy
item.text: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.
item.flavorText: "These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Resistance Fighter
item.text: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
item.flavorText: "My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Retribution of the Meek
item.text: Destroy all creatures with power 4 or greater. They can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "Tread upon the meek, and they shall wound your feet and make you crawl." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Righteous Aura
item.text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
item.flavorText: "Good is not a ‘thing.' You can neither touch nor own it. No, Good is a vision we all share and strive to make real." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Righteous War
item.text: White creatures you control have protection from black. Black creatures you control have protection from white.
item.flavorText: "This is a war without neutrality." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: River Boa
item.text: Islandwalk {G}: Regenerate River Boa.
item.flavorText: "But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Rock Slide
item.text: Rock Slide deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures without flying.
item.flavorText: "Good ol' rock. Nothing beats rock." —Rhirhok, goblin archer

item.name: Rowen
item.text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Sands of Time
item.text: Each player skips his or her untap step. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player simultaneously untaps each tapped artifact, creature, and land he or she controls and taps each untapped artifact, creature, and land he or she controls.
item.flavorText: "But once, with a magician's help, Time was stopped and Day stood still." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Scalebane's Elite
item.text: Protection from black
item.flavorText: "With Rashida's blades, my guiding vision and the luck of the blessed, today we will free Mangara" —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Shimmering Efreet
item.text: Flying Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.) Whenever Shimmering Efreet phases in, target creature phases out. (It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
item.flavorText: Life or death: which is the illusion?" —Naimah, Femeref philosopher

item.name: Shrieking Drake
item.text: Flying When Shrieking Drake enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Kaervek believes the drakes' cries herald his victory; in truth, they mourn aloud for his impending demise." —Teferi

item.name: Simoon
item.text: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.
item.flavorText: "The black-and-white sacred monkey holds her children to her, and waits." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Sisay's Ring
item.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "With this ring, you have friends in worlds you've never heard of." —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

item.name: Snake Basket
item.text: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Put X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
item.flavorText: "Uh, does anyone have a flute?" —Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

item.name: Solfatara
item.text: Target player can't play land cards this turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
item.flavorText: "A burst of hot air tossed the moon into the air, and the moon liked it up there so much it never needed the ground again." —Azeworai, "Glitter Moon"

item.name: Song of Blood
item.text: Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard. Whenever a creature attacks this turn, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each creature card put into your graveyard this way.
item.flavorText: Purraj sang slaughter and danced death.

item.name: Spider Climb
item.text: You may cast Spider Climb as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +0/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

item.name: Spitting Drake
item.text: Flying {R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
item.flavorText: It prefers its meals cooked.

item.name: Squandered Resources
item.text: Sacrifice a land: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type the sacrificed land could produce.
item.flavorText: "He traded sand for skins, skins for gold, gold for life. In the end, he traded life for sand." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Stampeding Wildebeests
item.text: Trample (If this creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.) At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: Prayers for rain are answered with the thunder of hooves.

item.name: Suleiman's Legacy
item.text: When Suleiman's Legacy enters the battlefield, destroy all Djinns and Efreets. They can't be regenerated. Whenever a Djinn or Efreet enters the battlefield, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: With Suleiman's ascension to power, the djinn and efreets of ancient Rabiah learned humility.

item.name: Summer Bloom
item.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
item.flavorText: "Our love is like the river in the summer season of long rains. / For a little while it spilled its banks, flooding the crops in the fields." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Sun Clasp
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+3. {W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "And darkness shall be cast from me For my soul resides in the Sun." —Femeref dirge

item.name: Suq'Ata Assassin
item.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.) Whenever Suq'Ata Assassin attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

item.name: Suq'Ata Lancer
item.text: Haste Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side." —Telim'Tor

item.name: Talruum Champion
item.text: First strike Whenever Talruum Champion blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature loses first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: In the Talruum language, there is no word for "surprised."

item.name: Talruum Piper
item.text: All creatures with flying able to block Talruum Piper do so.
item.flavorText: When the Talruum began to play, the dragons fell from the sky to squash the obnoxious noise.

item.name: Tar Pit Warrior
item.text: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
item.flavorText: "The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep." —Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

item.name: Teferi's Honor Guard
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) {U}{U}: Teferi's Honor Guard phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
item.flavorText: "They may seem ceremonial, but their swords are still sharp." —Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

item.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
item.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

item.name: Teferi's Realm
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses artifact, creature, land, or non-Aura enchantment. All nontoken permanents of that type phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
item.flavorText: "Fire is dead. Water has killed him." —From The Stories of Nature

item.name: Tempest Drake
item.text: Flying, vigilance
item.flavorText: "Its speed will be equaled only by the swiftness of my enemy's fall." —Kaervek

item.name: Three Wishes
item.text: Exile the top three cards of your library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled. Until your next turn, you may play those cards. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put any of those cards you didn't play into your graveyard.

item.name: Time and Tide
item.text: Simultaneously, all phased-out creatures phase in and all creatures with phasing phase out.
item.flavorText: "Time may heal all wounds, but what heals time?" —Teferi

item.name: Tin-Wing Chimera
item.text: Flying Sacrifice Tin-Wing Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Tithe
item.text: Search your library for a Plains card. If you control fewer lands than an opponent, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Tremor
item.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
item.flavorText: "Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?" —Naimah, Femeref philosopher

item.name: Triangle of War
item.text: {2}, Sacrifice Triangle of War: Choose target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to the other.
item.flavorText: The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.

item.name: Uktabi Orangutan
item.text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
item.flavorText: "Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?" —Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

item.name: Undiscovered Paradise
item.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. During your next untap step, as you untap your permanents, return Undiscovered Paradise to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: Jolrael's choice of homes was far better than her choice of allies.

item.name: Undo
item.text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
item.flavorText: "Oft have I wished to undo past deeds, but never did I imagine they would be undone for me." —Naimah, Femeref philosopher

item.name: Urborg Mindsucker
item.text: {B}, Sacrifice Urborg Mindsucker: Target opponent discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
item.flavorText: "My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine." —Kaervek

item.name: Vampiric Tutor
item.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
item.flavorText: "I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets." —Shauku, Endbringer

item.name: Vampirism
item.text: Enchant creature When Vampirism enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep. Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control. Other creatures you control get -1/-1.

item.name: Vanishing
item.text: Enchant creature {U}{U}: Enchanted creature phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
item.flavorText: "Careless, like a child with fire, so was I with time." —Teferi

item.name: Viashino Sandstalker
item.text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.) At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
item.flavorText: "Some believe Sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better." —Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

item.name: Viashivan Dragon
item.text: Flying {R}: Viashivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn. {G}: Viashivan Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The Viashivan understand that cruelty arises from opportunity.

item.name: Vision Charm
item.text: Choose one — Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard; or choose a land type and a basic land type, and each land of the first chosen type becomes the second chosen type until end of turn; or target artifact phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)

item.name: Wake of Vultures
item.text: Flying {1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.
item.flavorText: "So the vulture said to the griffin, ‘You gonna eat that?'" —Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

item.name: Wand of Denial
item.text: {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it's a nonland card, you may pay 2 life. If you do, put it into that player's graveyard.
item.flavorText: You'll never miss what you never had.

item.name: Warrior's Honor
item.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket." —Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant

item.name: Warthog
item.text: Swampwalk
item.flavorText: "Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits." —Grebog, goblin swine-rider

item.name: Waterspout Djinn
item.text: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Waterspout Djinn unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: "Fly us higher, out of its storm." —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

item.name: Wicked Reward
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Wicked Reward, sacrifice a creature. Target creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition." —Kaervek

item.name: Wind Shear
item.text: Attacking creatures with flying get -2/-2 and lose flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "As the winds abated, there was a shower of dragonscales, then nothing more." —Azeworai, "The Unruly Wind"

item.name: Zhalfirin Crusader
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zhalfirin Crusader this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
item.flavorText: "War is the crucible of leadership." —Rashida Scalebane
